Timo Klok

Frontend Developer & Digital Problem Solver

Email: mail@timoklok.nl

Web: www.timoklok.nl

About Me

Hi, my name’s Timo and I’m a front-end developer and allround problemsolver concerning all things digital. As well as developing sites and applications I also have experience in UX, motion graphics, print, VFX and art-education. I have worked on various commercial and non-commercial projects for a very divers range of clients.

I am currently most skilled in: HTML / CSS / JS and bad puns but always looking to develop.

Experience with Dipped toes into Would like to learn
HTML5, CSS(less/sass), JS/ES6 Python, PHP (Wordpress / Silverstripe) Tailwind CSS
Git, Subversion D3.js, Mocha, Karma Sanity.io, Netlify
Agile, Scrum Gatsby, Jekyll, Jest
Node, NPM, Express, GSAP Jenkins  
Google Design Sprints Service Design  
React & React Native, AngularJS Unity  
Adobe Creative Suite, Final Cut Pro, Cinema 4D, Sketch Storybook  

Experience

Eagerly Internet

Frontend Developer

Januari 2020 - now

Eagerly Internet advices in online communication and produces websites from design, to development and hosting. As a developer, I’m mostly involved with the creation and optimalisation of several cultural platforms (venues and festivals) end am currently developing a new narrowcasting platform (using React).

  • Front-end development
  • Setting out WCAG Accessibility guidelines

VPRO

Frontend Developer

Januari 2014 - December 2019

The VPRO is the most foreward thinking public broadcaster of The Netherlands, and I am very proud to have been part of the Innovation and Digital Media team. As a frontender I got to develop and maintain various platforms such as VPRO.nl and 3voor12. Besides, we produced one-off projects such as 14-18, Door het Hart van China, or Onzichtbaar Nederland and developed apps for specific programs such as Trees.

  • Front-end development
  • Product owner for 3voor12
  • Facilitating hackathons and Google Design Sprints

Restruct, sites & apps

Co-founder

2010 - 2014

At Restruct we conceptualized, designed and developed online solutions, all from a personal approach. As a small company of three designers/programmers, we specialized in user-friendly projects and processes.

  • front-end development
  • (UX-)design
  • concept-development
  • customer-relations.

Clients included: Rijksdienst voor Cultureel Erfgoed, Douwe Egberts, Asko/Shoenberg Ensemble, Willem de Kooning Academie, RET Rotterdam, HTM Den Haag, Spark Design, Pauluskerk Rotterdam, Gemeente Maassluis, CBRE/Rietmeijer

Piet Zwart Institute

Tutor

2009 - 2014

As a jack-of-all-trades I supported the Media Design & Communication (@ Piet Zwart Instituut, Willem de Kooning Academie, Hogeschool Rotterdam) department in various ways. I was a tutor first and foremost, supporting students in their projects, both technically and conceptually.

  • Personal tutor
  • Design and development of promotion-material
  • Producing expositions
  • Managing the student archive
  • Recording/documentation of live events.

Timo Klok

Freelance Media Designer

2005 - 2010

As a freelance designer, I had the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects. From web-development to motion graphics and from title design, grading to DVD-authoring, I became “the guy you called” when you needed a digital solution.

  • Motion graphics
  • Web development
  • Visual effects

Clients included: NIKE, VARA/HumorTV, Eddy Terstal, Wim Wenders, Habbekrats Reclame, Achtung, NCRV, KPN, 178 aardige ontwerpers, ON and others

Education

Media Design and Communication

Master of Design @ Piet Zwart Institute, Willem de Kooning Academie, HRO Rotterdam

2007 - 2009

The Piet Zwart Instute was an eye-opener: Taking control of your own production process by taking a deep dive into code and developing an understanding of the digital landscape in a historic, artistic and theoretic sense. The course focussed heavily on the importance of the open-source community. Got some attention when this materialized in a browser plugin linking The Pirate Bay to Amazon.com (one party wasn’t happy).

The two years resulted in a interactive installation that investigated the possibility of database-driven narration. Okay, it was actually a video-piece that created and endless James Bond movie mashup, ask me about it sometimes…

Image- and Media Technology

Master of Design @ Hogeschool van de Kunsten Utrecht, Hilversum

2002 - 2006

4 year course in animation and motion graphic design, in which I often collaborated in multidisciplinary AV-projects and got to work for real clients such as the VARA, Crossing Border Festival and Peter Greenaway. Graduated with a video installation combined with a research into the (artistic) theory of the sublime in relation to video-art.

Other

2001 - 2002 - Mediatechnology, HBO (propedeuse) @ Hogeschool van Utrecht, Amersfoort

1995 - 2001 - VWO, Coenecoop College, Waddinxveen

Courses

2018: Timemanagment (tijdwinst.com)

2017: Agile Project Management Foundation

2013: Post-HBO, Didactiek voor HBO Docenten HRO Rotterdam
